headline.main: THE NAVAL BRIGADE.; RETURN OF A PORTION OF THE COMMAND THEIR APPEAL TO THE UNION DEFENCE COMMITTEE.

docs.lead_paragraph: One hundred and eighty of the men constituting a portion of Lieut. BARTLETT's Brigade, returned from Fortress Monroe yesterday by the steamer, Coutza coalcos. On which they embarked from States Island about ten days ago. After landing, the men formed and visited several of the newspaper establishments to announce their arrival. Their appearance was calculated to excite commiseration.

docs.snippet: The Royal mail steamship Australasian, Capt. HOONLEY, which sailed from Liverpool at 10 A.M., on the 25th, and from Queenstown on the evening of the 26th ult., arrived here last evening.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; Arrival of the Australasian and the City of Washington. LARGE RECEIPTS OF SPECIE. Further Discussion of the American War in England. docs.snippet: It will be seen from our dispatches that a movement of the Federal troops was made yesterday in the direction of Manassas Gap. The exact nature of this movemnet, however, does not appear, though there is no doubt, now that the Government has...
docs.lead_paragraph: It will be seen from our dispatches that a movement of the Federal troops was made yesterday in the direction of Manassas Gap. The exact nature of this movemnet, however, does not appear, though there is no doubt, now that the Government has concluded to strikes a blow, that it will be an irresistible one.

docs.snippet: A formal meeting of the Massachusetts Relief Association was held here last evening, at which a report of the condition of the sick and wounded troops was-made.

headline.main: NOTES OF THE REBELLION.; FROM THE EIGHTH REGIMENT. Correspondence of the New-York Times:

docs.lead_paragraph: This has been the hottest day we have encountered since leaving New York. As it is Sunday the camp has remained inactive, no drill or parade having been ordered. It is probable we shall remain in our present quarters several days yet, at least. Ths Fifth
